article.headline: Norfolk State 82, Howard 79
article.story: NORFOLK, Va. (AP) -- Tony Murphy hit a 3-pointer with five seconds left to give Norfolk State an 82-79 victory over Howard on Saturday night. Murphy led the Spartans (3-10, 2-1 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference) with 26 points on 8-of-16 shooting, including 5-of-11 from 3-point range. Norfolk State led 71-56 after Calvin Brown's layup with 6:25 left, but Darryl Hudson hit all 10 of his free throw attempts during a 23-4 run that put Howard ahead 79-75 with 1:29 left. Murphy scored on a layup 13 seconds later, and Larry Vickers tied it 79-79 with a layup with 30 seconds left. Murphy hit the game-winner after Howard's Louis Ford turned the ball over with 10 seconds remaining. Karandick Ogunride scored 12 points and Keith Young added 11 for Norfolk State. Will Grant led Howard with 22 points and Hudson, who was 15-of-16 from the line, added 18. Ford scored 12 and Derek Mitchell 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
